orbital.title: Orbital Robotics
orbital.description: Autonomous systems for spacecraft operations, orbital servicing, and cislunar exploration.

areas.title: Cislunar Trajectory Design
areas.description: Orbit family analysis (NRHO, DRO, axial orbits), low-energy trajectory design, and CubeSat deployment strategies for lunar and deep-space missions.

areas.title: Spacecraft-Manipulator Control
areas.description: Unified control frameworks for on-orbit servicing, satellite capture, and debris removal using model predictive control and reinforcement learning.

areas.title: Space Situational Awareness
areas.description: Optical detection and tracking of orbital debris, sensor design for sub-10cm object identification, and collision avoidance systems.

areas.title: Satellite Station-Keeping
areas.description: Autonomous station-keeping strategies for lunar orbits, fuel-optimal maneuver planning, and long-duration mission support.

areas.title: CubeSat Resilience
areas.description: Fault-tolerant architectures, estimator-aware anomaly detection, and verification methods for small satellite reliability.

planetary.title: Planetary/Terrestrial Robotics
planetary.description: Autonomous navigation, perception, and mobility for robots operating on lunar and Martian surfaces.

areas.title: Cooperative Localization
areas.description: Multi-robot state estimation, physics-informed sensor fusion, and distributed navigation for GNSS-denied planetary environments.

areas.title: Autonomous Robot Learning
areas.description: Reinforcement learning and graph neural networks for locomotion, navigation, and manipulation skills on legged and wheeled platforms.

areas.title: Uncertainty-Aware Perception
areas.description: Deep learning-based terrain perception with rigorous uncertainty quantification for safety-critical lunar and Martian operations.

areas.title: Terrain Classification & Trafficability
areas.description: Semantic segmentation and probabilistic mapping for lunar South Pole terrain assessment and autonomous path planning.

areas.title: Field Robotics Platforms
areas.description: Quadruped and rover autonomy stacks with ROS 2, edge computing, and multi-sensor pipelines validated in unstructured environments.

areas.title: Hybrid Locomotion & Terramechanics
areas.description: Bio-inspired end-effectors, quadruped-quadcopter hybrid systems, and terramechanics-based mobility for planetary surface operations.
